FuncDef:
The nms-address command specifies the IP address of a network management system (NMS) that communicates with a gateway network element (GNE).
The undo nms-address command deletes the IP address of the NMS that communicates with the GNE.
By default, no NMS IP address is specified on a GNE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of an NMS.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow users to remotely manage NEs, the NMS must support automatic NE discovery. To implement this function, you must configure the IP address of the NMS to which the GNE automatically reports NE information and enable automatic reporting.
The nms-address ip-address command is supported only in transport mode.
Configuration Impact
GNE will automatically report network element information to the network administrator under it. At present, up to five network administrator addresses are allowed to be configured.
Follow-up Procedure
To enable the GNE to automatically report NE information to the NMS, run the auto-report command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
